trial_identification.studytitle: Curing Atrial Fibrillation: A Comparison of 2 Keyhole Techniques
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Minimal versus Maximal Radiofrequency Ablation to Achieve Enduring freedom from Atrial Fibrillation

interventions.interventions: Pulmonary vein isolation by wide encircling ablation of ipsilateral veins with linear ablation of the intervenous ridge. This procedure takes 2-4 hours and involves advancing specialized catheters into the heart via a keyhole approach, and using heat energy to place strategically-positioned scars in the upper chambers of the heart to cure atrial fibrillation. It is done as a one-off procedure, though occassionally a second procedure is required.
interventions.comparator: Pulmonary vein isolation by wide encircling ablation of ipsilateral veins without linear ablation of the intervenous ridge. This procedure takes 2-4 hours and involves advancing specialized catheters into the heart via a keyhole approach, and using heat energy to place strategically-positioned scars in the upper chambers of the heart to cure atrial fibrillation. It is done as a one-off procedure, though occassionally a second procedure is required.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Single procedure success at 12 months from the date of procedure defined by freedom from atrial fibrillation by symptoms and holter monitoring.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 12 months from the date of procedure.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Procedural complications at 12 months from the date of procedure. Acute complications: pericaridal tamponade judged by need for pericardiocentesis, signficant groin haematoma/bleed judged by need for ultrasound imaging or blood transfusion, stroke based on clinical assessment post procedure and at follow up. Long-term complications: pulmonary vein stenosis based on follow-up CT pulmonary venography.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 12 months from the date of procedure.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Age 18 or greater Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation Failure of at least one antiarrhythmic medication Suitable for 1st time atrial fibrillation ablation
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Pregnancy Contraindications to atrial fibrillation ablation

trial_design.concealment: Patients referred for consideration of first time atrial fibrillation (AF) ablation will be screened and enrolled. Randomization into interventional arms will be determined by coin-toss on the day of the intervention.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Clinical Electrophysiolog Research, Baker IDI Heart and Diabetes Institute 75 Commercial Road Melbourne Victoria 2004

fundingsource.fundingname: Clinical Electrophysiology Research, Baker IDI Heart and Diabetes Institute

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Atrial fibrillation is a common heart rhythm disorder and is associated with heart rhythm irregularity. This trial aims to compare the relative efficacy of 2 different keyhole procedures to cure atrial fibrillation.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: The Alfred Human Research Ethics Committee

contact.name: Liang-han Ling
